Developer Portfolio

Madhu kiran (@madki)

I am primarily an Android developer who happens to have worked with a few web and backend projects. I was the co-founder of Workarounds and before that I worked with IDC, IIT Bombay on a few interesting projects. I was working with Headout in the role of android and java backend developer for the past year.

Currently playing with a few ideas for mobile games.

Headout (Android)

March 2016 - August 2016

Developed the android app for Headout from scratch. Used MVP pattern to write modular and testable code in combination with RxJava. Gave a talk about the RxMVP pattern in BLRDroid meetup.

Playstore

Headout (Backend)

August 2016 - March 2017

Worked in the backend team at Headout. Migrated the codebase to use gradle as the build tool. Led a team of 3 to automate bookings by integrating with third party vendor APIs. Wrote a java wrapper for jqgrid to generate admin panels using hibernate models.

Github

Define

March 2015 â€“ Present

Define is a open source system wide dictionary for android. It provides a easily dismissable floating UI (similar to facebook's chatheads) to the user upon copying text anywhere in the system. This allows users to find definitions of words without moving away from the current app. Currently Define supports Wiktionary (offline and in multiple languages), Wordnet and Urban Dictiory.

The app handles rotation seamlessly and is optimized for all screen sizes. It is written in a modular fashion using MVP architecture, Dagger 2 and relies highly on RxJava. It takes advantange of runtime permissions that Android M offers. It has a rating of 4.5 stars and over 10,000 downlods.

Playstore Github

The floating UI is optimized for landscape and bigger screen sizes

Swarachakra

April 2014 - May 2014

Swarachakra is a keyboard designed for Indic languages. The letters of the Indic languges are different from Latin scripts as 2 or more of the unicodes combine to form various complex letters. So the standard qwerty keyboard layout is ineffective. So a novel keyboard layout with a different interaction model was developed.

The app extends a InputMethodService to provide a new keyboard. It's available in 12 Indic languages on Playstore. The capability to have build flavors is leveraged as the keyboard for each langugage has changes that are more that just string localisations

Playstore Github

The keyboard supports two different layouts and sizes

Optimized for landscape

ListUp

October 2015

ListUp is an android app that offers a platform for hyper local buy and sell. Developed this production ready app for the startup by implementing a pixel perfect design and integrating with the REST APIs.

The app is well received on the playstore with a rating of 4.9 stars.

Playstore

Instilive

Sept 2014 - Jan 2015

Instilive is an events portal designed for IIT Bombay. The website integrates seamlessly with facebook. It uses tags to categorize posts and has tools and architecture for moderation and posting rights to various categories. The website was used for Inter IIT 2015

Developed both the backed and the front end. The backend was developed over a LAMP stack using cakePHP and serves REST APIs. The front-end was developed in AngularJS. The front-end is opensourced on github.

Demo Github

Mobile optimized website built using AngularJS, Angular Material, LESS

InstiMap

July 2014 - Aug 2014

An android app that show cases a beautiful map of IIT Bombay overlayed with various points of interest. The app has a searchable index of all the locations inside IIT Bombay. It displays various locations and points of interest based on the zoom level.

The app features delightful animations and color codes for categorizing and displaying the information.

Playstore Github

The app offers a fuzzy search to find places inside the campus

Shopping Buddy

March 2014

It is an android app that lists the offers available in near by stores. It also aims to help the users browse big stores by showing them relevant offers when they are walking through the stores. It uses BLE beacons to effectively determine the location of the user and show relevant details.

  • Developed a UI that is inspired by google Newsstand.
  • Utilized native android location APIs to find a user's location.
  • Used android Bluetooth adapter to scan for the beacons and triangulate a more accurate location of a user inside a building.
Playstore

Sign in with facebook/google

Uses native android APIs to find current location

Bundler

October 2015 - Present

Bundler is a android library that aims to make passing intents and bundle type safe and easy. It uses annotation processing to generate broiler plate code that would be required to achieve this. The library is hosted on jcentre and the repo has gained a lot of popularity immediately after it's recent release.

Github

Flyrobe

March 2014

It is an android app that offers a rental service for fashionable clothes. Consulted with them to improve the performance of the app and develop new features.

  • Implemented a caching system to improve the load times.
  • Developed a custom size picker widget that looks like a measuring tape.
  • Improved the performance by debugging and eliminating memory leaks and threading issues.
Playstore

PSTakecare

Feb 2015 - July 2015

A startup with focus in health care industry that aims to simplify the process of finding and consulting with a doctor. Developed an internal team management app that helps them organize the work force and collect data efficiently.

  • Developed an app that consumes REST APIs and authenticates with tokens.
  • Developed custom-views that directly bind to a json response and parse and build respective jsons based on the view-heirarchy

I also blog at times. Find me on twitter and github
